title: Complex Structures Defined on Dynamically Triangulated Surfaces
abstract: A method to define the complex structure and separate the conformal mode is proposed for a surface constructed by two-dimensional dynamical triangulation. Applications are made for surfaces coupled to matter fields such as $n$ scalar fields ($n=0,1$ and $4$) and $m$ Ising spins ($m=1$ and $3$). We observe a well-defined complex structure for cases when the matter central charges are less than and equal to one, while it becomes unstable beyond $c=1$. This can be regarded as the transition expected in analytic theories.
